name: Splendid Etoile Hotel

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed October 2007, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: I chose this hotel due to previous reviews on TripAdvisor and we were not disappointed. While comparing the rates, we decided to splurge for a suite and we were not disappointed. We had the corner suite which overlooked not only the Arc but also Rue de Carnot. The rooms were spacious and the bathroom beautifully appointed. We loved it.
reviews.title: WOW what a fantastic property, fantastic location, and caring staff!

likes.liked: — The quality of the room, cleanliness and location. Also the kind, attentive assistance of Farooq
likes.disliked: — Cost was the most we ever spent at a hotel, but as compared to the rest of Paris,it was reasonable.

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed October 2007, traveled with family
reviews.text: The view from our room was fabulous -- we could see not only the Arc but also the Eiffel Tower -- you just can't get any better than that! We felt so charmed and special and delighted by this! We loved having the suite because with jet lag, sometimes one of us was up in the living room reading or watching TV, while the other was in the bedroom sleeping. There were pocket door separating the two so it was very handy.
reviews.title: Spectacular Visit (-- in spite of a train strike)

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed October 2007, traveled with friends
reviews.text: Other reviews mention the busy traffic and quietness of the rooms. We were astounded by the fact that the thick curtains, which are drawn at night over closed windows, TOTALLY blocked out the sounds of traffic, sirens, and helicopters. Yes, helicopters! The first morning we were there, there was some type of traffic accident or medical emergency on the round about around the Arc. Many, many emergency vehicles came including a helicopter, presumably to remove the injured. Traffic came to a dead standstill, and probably caused havoc throughout this part of Paris.
reviews.title: Paris Delight

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed May 2007, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: We walked to the Eiffel Tower at night (the concierge said it was about 15 minutes but that must be in 'french walk speed' as it took us about 30 minutes. We thoroughly enjoyed the walk and especially loved seeing the tower lit up. We took a cab back and it was only 6 euro, well worth it as our feet were tired by then.
reviews.title: Our Honeymoon

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed September 2007, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: We also got brave and took the Metro (subway) to the Louvre, based on Farooq's advice. The entrance to the Metro is right next to the hotel - it can't get any easier! We also took the Air France bus from DeGualle Airport based on Farooq's advice and were happy we did. It was only $13euro each and let us off directly across from the hotel. That was amazing!
reviews.title: Paris excellence

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed April 2008, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: We just stayed 7 nights at this wonderful hotel. Our room on the 6th floor was a large room overlooking the Arc d' Triomphe and Eiffel Tower. Chief Concierge 'Farooq' is the best, along with reservation specialist 'Francoise' who helped with train tickets.
reviews.title: What a Location and View

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed November 2007, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: We will definitely stay here again on our return to Paris.
reviews.title: Great Hotel--everything you want to know

reviews.title: Essence of Paris from your balcony

reviews.title: Great location, great rooms!
reviews.text: My husband and I spent 8 nights here in November of 2007 for our 10 year wedding anniversary. We booked our flight and hotel package through Travelocity and decided not to upgrade from the standard room. We bought the round-trip shuttle bus tickets from Air France, at the airport, to take us to the hotel. Visit the Air France Shuttle website to find where the ticket window is in the terminal. It was very, very easy as it drops you off across the street and the buses run very early in the morning until very late at night and it's got to be the cheapest way, less then 20 Euros each.

reviews.title: perfect in paris
reviews.text: have been to paris a number of times but this hotel is the best i have stayed in---the staff including the concierge are amazing-farooq is friendly,helpful and the best front man a hotel could ask for.

reviews.title: Had a wonderful experience at the Etolie
reviews.text: We statyed at the Splendid Etoile for 3 nights are were most pleased. We dealt directly with the hotel for reservations and recommend this method as the staff's English is much better than my French. We carried our luggade via the Metro from Gard Nu Nord because we had read in this forum a Metro entrance / exit is directly across the street from the hotel. This is correct, the Metro is directly across the street. Please be forewarned the trip from Gard Nu Nord, changing to the Metro, and exiting via Charles De Gaulle Etoile Station involves numerous steps requiring alot of lugging and lifting. On the return trip opted for a taxi which worked much better for us. Upon our arrival, we were upgraded to a room with a balcony and view of the Arc de Triomphe. Like so many of the reviews in this forum, the staff was professional, courteous, and most helpful. The daily breakfast was excellent and the cafe across the street is very good, too. Being our first time in Paris, we relied solely on Trip Advisor review of the Hotel Splendid Etoile and were not disappointed. With the Metro across the street access throughout Paris is effort free and it's a 10 minute stroll to the Champ Elysees.

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed June 2007, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: We were very pleased with our experience at the hotel. We stayed for three nights at the start of our vacation. What made the experience so good was the friendly and helpful front desk staff. They went out of their way to help with our mobile phone and with restaurant recommendations.
reviews.title: A great start to our stay in France
A lovely place to stay
reviews.text: The room was clean and well-decorated. Had a safe and internet access. The area was good with a selection of restaurants and bakeries. Many English speaking guests at the hotel.

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed June 2007, traveled with family
reviews.text: We stayed at this great hotel for four nights. We arrived at the hotel late (about 11.30pm) and we were greeted by the friendly staff. We had a superior room on the 2nd floor overlooking the road, but had two french doors (double glazed for complete soundproofing) that opened onto a balcony with amazing views of the Arc de Triomphe. The main bedroom was large, light, clean with high ceilings. There was also air conditioning which we didn't really need to use. The metro (Charles-de-Gaulle Etoile, exit 5) is right outside the hotel with a lift for your suitcases.
reviews.title: My first hotel stay in Paris

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed May 2007, traveled with friends
reviews.text: All in all a great place to stay, I would recommend this hotel to my friends.
reviews.title: LOVED this hotel!!!!

reviews.title: A Dream Stay In Paris!!
Amazing Stay - trust the reviews!

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed November 2007, traveled as a couple

The Arc is RIGHT THERE! (uploaded photos). The room was very roomy and a peaceful oasis once we returned from our many walks. The small touches of the window details, furniture, etc - amazing. Very large bathroom, very clean, large closet, flat screen TV & robes in the bathroom. Take a look at the hidden spiral staircase in the hallway if you get a chance - wow!

reviews.text: The hotel is just a few feet away for the Air France Bus drop off and the metro station. The real beauty is the view; you really feel that you’re in a movie. And there is nothing better than taking your late evening glass of wine on the balcony looking at the Arc de Triomphe and the Parisian in the flats across the street prepare for dinner. The rooms are huge, especially compared to other Paris Hotels. It’s by far the best value in Paris in terms of location, room, service.

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed September 2006, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Stayed at the hotel for 8 days in September 2006 with my boyfriend, we're 29 & 36. Found it to be exactly as others describle. I thought the room was great, rm 403. Big bathroom, lots of closet/drawer space, excellent a/c and 2 french doors to the balcony with view of Arc. The hotel never seemed crowded, the staff was helpful and spoke excellent English. I like that you never had to carry your key around they hold it at the front desk. We did return every night after the doors were locked and never waited more than a few minutes for them to open it for us.

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed August 2006, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: I was very nervous booking a hotel on Travelocity since I had never been to Paris. It turned out the be better that we could have expected. We were in Paris for 4 days and loved it. I think our impression of the entire city had a lot to do with the hotel. Fantastic location - we walked everywhere, but it wasn't loud or crowded right outside the hotel. Great view - we had a corner room with a direct view of the Arc de Triomphe, just like the pictures on the internet show. The room was spacious, especially the bathroom. The staff at the front desk made us feel so welcome. They were friendly, happy to speak English, and gave great suggestions for restaurants and photo opportunities. They also kept our luggage after we checked out the last day so we could spend a few more hours enjoying the city.
reviews.title: Highly recommend this hotel

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed September 2006, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: A few tips - take the Air France bus to and from the hotel if you are flying into the city. It was so easy, just as quick as a taxi, and it stops in front of the hotel. You can even buy tickets at the front desk. Buy some bottled water and snacks at the grocery store (we found one a block or so from the hotel). It is hard to find a cheap bite to eat when you are out touring the city.

reviews.title: It's All True
reviews.text: We have just returned from a weekend break at the SE and we had a great time. After booking I contacted the hotel to ask whether I could get a room with a view of the Arc de Triomphe. The reply was that it was unlikely but they would see what they could do so we were very very pleased to get rm 207 which is the corner room over looking the Arc. It is an amazing room. For Paris standards it is very big and the bathroom was fantastic but it is the view that makes it so special, espcially at night. There is no traffic noise due to the sound proofing and the air con is quiet and efficient.

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed November 2006, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: My wife wanted to stay at the Paris Hilton because she wanted a king-size bed and a large room in a great location, but I wanted a Parisian hotel that came close to American hotel standards with the best combination of price, room size, and location, location, location. I searched the internet for weeks. Using Trip Advisor, I found everything we were looking for (and more) with the Hotel Splendid Etoile. We enjoyed six memorable nights there starting November 21.
reviews.title: In my opinion, The Best Hotel in Paris!

likes.disliked: — The bed could be a bit more comfortable

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed February 2002, traveled with family
reviews.text: Price: This is not an inexpensive hotel in comparison to hotels in most parts of the US, but as compared to the prices at New York City hotels, it was comparable. Plus, the prices quoted already included the 19.8% French Value-Added Tax. Thus, there was no sticker-shock upon checkout as at American hotels in high-tax cities. When compared to other Paris hotels with similar attributes, the Hotel Splendid Etoile is a good value.
reviews.title: Truly splendid!

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed November 2006, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Room: We stayed in a Superior room which, in my opinion, is the best Superior room in the entire hotel (room 507). It is a corner room with three balcony windows, one of which is in the bathroom. One of the windows in the bedroom faces directly on the Arc d’Triumphe without obstruction. The picture of this room on the hotel’s web site is very accurate (see my picture below). It is a fantastic view. Plus, stepping out onto the wrap-around balcony you have a terrific view of the top 2/3 of the Eiffel Tower. The size of the room was comparable to what we have come to expect with American hotels, except the bathroom was larger. It included a bathtub with shower AND shower curtain (not one of those ½ plexiglass walls that invariably lead to us Americans spraying the floor with tons of water). It also included a bidet that I tried out just to say I had done that at least once in my life (It’s a French thing that most Americans who shower every day would never use.) The bathroom was always clean and well-stocked. There were two fluffy robes in addition to the usual towels, etc. Yes, the towels could be fluffier, but they were large enough for my rotund body and they got the job done. The king-sized bed was comfortable, but it was not up to the newest standards of hotels such as W, Hilton, and Marriott in the U.S. I was particularly pleased that the bed had a sheet and blanket instead of a duvet (there was a duvet in the closet for those who prefer one). Even though traffic noise from the circle around the Arc with the windows open is virtually non-stop around the clock, the room was very quiet with the windows closed. We had absolutely no trouble sleeping.
reviews.title: What Agreat Hotel

likes.liked: — Accessability to the Metro and attractions and retaurants

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed November 2006, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Location: This hotel has it. Literally steps away from the front door is an elevator to the Metro and RER station. Most stations don’t even have an escalator, let alone an elevator! Steps away from the elevator inside the station is a large ticket booth where you can buy "carnets" of 10 tickets at reduced prices. The staff at this ticket booth spoke English and gave us a Metro map specifically aimed at tourists such as ourselves. From this metro station you have access to line 1, which can take you to the Louvre and other central Paris locations, and line 6 which can take you to the Eiffel Tower and Montparnasse Tower. These two lines intersect with almost every other Metro and RER line in the system, so you are within 20 minutes of just about every place you would want to go in the city. From the entrance of the hotel, turn right and walk for about a block and you are at the entrance to the tunnel leading to the Arc d’Triumphe. The start (or end, depending on your point of view) of the Champs Elysees is at the other end of the tunnel. The neighborhood has many small shops and restaurants, and a terrific patisserie (bakery) one block down the street (it is not open on Mondays). Ask the concierge for a recommendation and you will not be disappointed. That brings me to ...
reviews.title: Great location

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed May 2006, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Hotel Staff: The head concierge, Farouq, is simply outstanding! I have never encountered another concierge who was as friendly and willing to go the extra mile as he is. His recommendations for restaurants were spot-on accurate for what we were looking for. His staff are equally competent, friendly, and willing to help, although they cannot match his wonderfully pleasant and outgoing personality. All of them spoke very good English and we never had a communication problem. They tolerated my attempts at speaking in French, and even gave me the correct room key despite the fact that my dyslexic brain asked for the key to room cinq cent six instead of cinq cent sept! The housekeeping staff visited the room several times a day so it always looked fresh each time we entered.
reviews.title: The best experience!!!

likes.liked: — the wonderful location-right in front of a metro stop!

reviews.title: Fantastic Gem of A Hotel
reviews.text: The Hotel is in a fantastic, quiet neighborhood just one block from the Arc de Triomphe and Champs Elysees and is surrounded by many fabulous cafes and restaurants. The front desk staff is fantastic and attentive even when the lobby is crowded with people. Farooq is a national treasure and went above and beyond with assisting us. The Air France bus stops directing across the street which provided easy, hassle free transportation to CDG/Roissy. They dropped at our terminal. There is a cab stand and a metro stop steps from the hotel... actual steps not a 15 minute walk steps.

reviews.title: Wonderful stay there
reviews.text: A walk to the Eiffel Tower took about 20 minutes. The Louvre and other places of interest for us took about 45, but Paris is a city for walking.

reviews.title: Great Stay
reviews.text: All rooms do not have a view of the Arc. Sadly ours did not, but it was spacious and comfortable just the same. If I recall 207, a superior room, had the postcard view from the terrace. I would definitely return!

reviews.title: A Nice weekend in Pairs
reviews.text: We stayed there from 8.-12.5.08. We found this hotel by Trip Advisor and we chose this one because of the great reviews there. We didn’t regret. This hotel is superb choise and we had wonderful stay there. Is has perfect location. Metro station is in front of the hotel and it’s very easy to get everywhere. The street is quiet despite of the traffic around the Arch of Triumph. We’ve wonderful view of the Arch of Triumph and stayed at superior room. It was spacious, perfect clean and very comfortable, nice furnished and decorated. But the classic rooms are not so spacious, so choose the superior if you can. At the reception the staff is very kind, helpful and speaks English fluently. They’ve recommended us superb fish restaurant near the hotel – 2 stations far from the hotel at Porte Maillot (only negative – quite expensive). Breakfast room is nice and modern decorated and the served food is good and quite various – e.g. fresh salmon (it not so usual at other Europeans 4stars hotels).

reviews.title: Just wonderful and amazing

reviews.text: My daughter and I enjoyed a perfectly delightful 4 night stay at this gem of a hotel as we celebrated her big 40th birthday in Paris. From my first e-mail to confirm details, nothing I requested was left undone. From the 'rose carrying' driver who waited more than an hour for us at the airport because of our delay to report last luggage, to the holding of choice tickets at both the Moulin Rouge and Le Lido so we could decide and the personal handling of our luggage by the chief concierge, Farouq, both at our arrival and departure..........It would be difficult to cite ways in which we could have been more courteously and efficiently served.

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed January 2007, traveled with family
reviews.text: We are so thankful for the Trip Advisors service that led us to this wondeful hotel. The staff was exquisitely polite, friendly and informative. The concierge Farouk single-handedly was responsible for making our stay in Paris an absolute delight. He personally escorted us to two wonderful neighborhood restaurants (one for lunch and one for dinner). Our room had magnificent views. From one window we were on top of the Arch de Triomphe and the other displayed the magical twinkling color spectacle of the Eiffle Tower! No breafkfast included but plenty of reasonable nearby breakfast bistros. Just ask Farouk he won't steer you wrong. Also check out the nightclub Club E'toile down the street - people were lined up outside for four blocks on Halloween - I would get there by 11 to beat the crowd on the weekend.. We agree with those before us that this is a very good hotel in a great location. Taxis are just outside as well as Public Transportaion and plenty of great places nearby including the Champs d'Elysees!

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed October 2007
reviews.text: My mom and I went to Paris in October and stayed at the Splendid Etoile. The location is fantastic, and the hotel was even better than we anticipated. I had read the great reviews on tripadvisor and was pretty confident that we would enjoy the hotel, but my expectations were really exceeded. The rooms are much bigger than others I've stayed in in Paris and the view can't be beat. However, it was the staff that really made all the difference. Not only were they accomodating, but they were great people with whom we enjoyed talking all week. The concierge, Farooq, is simply a treasure. We talked to him at length a couple of times, and it was as if we had a good friend in Paris. He had great insight on Paris, traveling, and life in general. We will stay at this hotel again whenever we visit Paris and look forward to seeing Farooq and all the members of the staff.

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed September 2008, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: We stayed at the hotel for six nights in September and had an absolutely wonderful stay. The staff at this hotel are absolutely world-class, always friendly, and go out of their way to assist with any and every detail large and small. Special kudos to concierge Farouk (hope I'm spelling that correctly) who arranged a wonderful dinner cruise for my fiancee and I on the night of her birthday and was most helpful with our every request. The room was spacious, spotless, and outstanding, offering a wonderful view from the balcony of the Arc de Triomphe. The hotel is located in a great area, with several terrific restaurants and bars all withing walking distance and the Metro is literally right out of the front door of the hotel. I have visited Paris on several occasions in the past but have never enjoyed a stay as much as I did this time. This is our hotel in Paris from now on, without a doubt. Can't say enough about the place and the staff. Wonderful!
reviews.title: Wonderful hotel, wonderful staff, wonderful stay!!

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed August 2008, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: We stayed at The Splendid Etoile for 3 nights Bed and Breakfast in August and I am delighted to say that it met all my expectations. This hotel is a pricey 4 star but certainly ticks all your boxes for a luxury romantic Parisienne break. After shopping round for the best rate I found a deal on eurostars own website which gave you the 3rd night free and breakfast and a pound upgrade to 1st class seats on the train. I then contacted the hotel direct to request an upgrade to a superior room before we arrived, as I wanted to ensure that we had a room with a view. Our room was the corner room on the 4th floor and the view was just magical. We had most amazing view of the Arc de Triomphe from the 2 balconies in the bedroom, and my husband boasted that he could even see the top of the Eiffel Tower from the balcony in the bathroom! I couldnt fault the standard of the furnishings in the room which was spotlessly maintained. The Buffet Breakfast was "2 die for" and there was so much food on offer that it kept us going until tea time (.... a huge benefit in Paris as the restaurants are ridiculously over priced ! ) One word of warning though, is that breakfast is only served until 10.30am prompt - not until 12pm or 11.30am as the staff and hotel literature advise you ! We witnessed a number of dissapointed hungry guests being turned away at 10.31am. The hotel was superbly located at the top of the Champs Elysee which caters for those of you who either want to walk or take the metro. Sadly the hotel bar was closed throughout our stay which left us feeling a little short changed on the facilities front - but the staff were professional, polite and discreet at all times and I would definately return again.
reviews.title: A perfect Paris hotel

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed September 2007, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: This hotel was in a very convenient location to transportation. We left the CDG airport via Air France Bus which stops right outside the hotel across the street. The Metro is also right across the street. We stayed in room 507 based on another review we read here and we loved it. The room was nicely decorated. We slept with the balcony doors open for the cool breeze and it was relatively quiet, except for the occasional ambulance passing by. The view of the ARC was awesome! When I stood outside on the balcony I felt like I was looking at a painting. There was even a balcony in the bathroom although you could not see the Arc from this balcony. The room and bathroom both were large for Europe standards and they were very clean. Staff are very friendly and efficient. I will definetly stay at this hotel on my next visit to Paris.

description: Ideally located facing the Arc de Triomphe, two steps from the Champs Elysées and close to the business district of La Défense, the Hotel Splendid Etoile, welcomes you in a setting combining luxury, charm and tradition.Welcome to the hotel:The Hotel Splendid Etoile, 57 rooms and suites, will charm you thanks to its cordial setting and refined atmosphere.This mansion dating back from 1880, was built in the purest Haussmann style and opens largely on the Place de l’Etoile.
